# The `AAMemoryLocation` Struct Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

An abstract interface for all memory location attributes (readnone/argmemonly/inaccessiblememonly/inaccessibleorargmemonly). <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>struct llvm::AAMemoryLocation</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

An abstract interface for all memory location attributes (readnone/argmemonly/inaccessiblememonly/inaccessibleorargmemonly).

Definition at line 4709 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### checkForAllAccessesToMemoryKind() {#aec4f1c7abc767de9538c126136a46bf4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual bool llvm::AAMemoryLocation::checkForAllAccessesToMemoryKind (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">function&#95;ref</a>&lt; bool(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;, <a href="#ace2d4d5ab8dffea597c39bc129d90f7f">AccessKind</a>, <a href="#acffe374fb52ac7da0511285fdf18db3f">MemoryLocationsKind</a>)&gt; Pred, <a href="#acffe374fb52ac7da0511285fdf18db3f">MemoryLocationsKind</a> MLK) const</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> <code>Pred</code> on all accesses to the memory kinds specified by <code>MLK</code>.

This method will evaluate <code>Pred</code> on all accesses (access instruction + underlying accessed memory pointer) and it will return true if <code>Pred</code> holds every time.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h/#l04861">4861</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getAssumedNotAccessedLocation() {#ad7370cc538424a0e12fd632cb076c14c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="MemoryLocationsKind llvm::AAMemoryLocation::getAssumedNotAccessedLocation () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return the locations that are assumed to be not accessed by the associated function, if any.

### inverseLocation() {#afc0831ad69241e3cde373281a1024848}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static MemoryLocationsKind llvm::AAMemoryLocation::inverseLocation (<a href="#acffe374fb52ac7da0511285fdf18db3f">MemoryLocationsKind</a> Loc, bool AndLocalMem, bool AndConstMem)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Return the inverse of location <code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loc">Loc</a></code>, thus for NO&#95;XXX the return describes ONLY&#95;XXX.

The flags <code>AndLocalMem</code> and <code>AndConstMem</code> determine if local (=stack) and constant memory are allowed as well. Most of the time we do want them to be included, e.g., argmemonly allows accesses via argument pointers or local or constant memory accesses.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h/#l04840">4840</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
